> Dear all.
> I am just looking at upgrading our harvesting system to use  =

> Heritrix 1.10.
> One of the things that happened between 1.8 and 1.10 is=
 that the  
> constructor
> ARCWriter(AtomicInteger, PrintStream, File, boo=
lean, String, List)  
> is no longer visible.
>
> We are currently using th=
at constructor.
Hi S=F8ren,

The change happened between revision 1.46 and =
1.47 of that file.   
Stack was in the middle of adding experimental WARC s=
upport to  
Heritrix.  The visibility change may have been related, but fro=
m the  
CVS log it looks like it was a simple error.  I'll ask Michael when=
  
he returns on Monday.

Can you use an ARCWriterPool to produce your ARCW=
riters?

As an aside, the constructor in question didn't actually exist in =
 
1.8; the 1.10 version uses a new parameter (the AtomicInteger).  So  
I'm=
 afraid binary compatibility is broken anyway, regardless of the  
visibili=
ty.

-Paul
